Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at Gea”
Reviews.Author: NorwayJan
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we enjoied it as much as last time. The location(on Via Nationale) is very good - you can walk to nearly every attraction in the city. it is a ten minutes walk to Forum and the same to the Trevi fountain. The staff is very friendly and the room was nice.There were some noise from the street in the morning and the breakfast could have been more varied but all in all we are very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before and will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Cath A
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel on the first floor of an Italian 'palazzo', just ten minutes' walk from Termini station (very convenient for getting to and from airports) and very close to the Piazza della Repubblica (very convenient for buses, Metro and McDonald's if you really must eat McDonald's while in Rome). I havstayed previously by myself, but stayed this time with some American friends (who did want to eat McDonald's) and we shared a family room (slept four) which was large and spacious, with its own exit onto the side street - very handy when getting a taxi back to the airport as we could load all the cases without causing traffic problems). We had a key to the external door so getting back late at night was no problem. The hotel is spotlessly clean, internet access is fast and free (rare in Rome), the breakfast is full with a good choice of pastries, fruit, cereals and juices, and the staff are lovely - extremely helpful, very efficient and really wanting to make sure you have a good stay at the hotel. It's about a twenty minute walk from here into the city centre (to the Trevi Fountain, for example). The Metro is good for getting across to St Peter's which would otherwise be quite a hike - and despite all the hype the Metro is not dangerous as long as you're sensible. The 'hop on, hop off' buses run from Termini so again, very convenient. Drawbacks? If you have a lot of bags getting them up the stairs might be a problem - ring the buzzer at the front door and ask the hotel receptiomnist to meet you with the key to the lift (elevator) - makes life much easier. The hotel is situated on the Via Nazionale which is an extremely busy road, so be prepared for some noise in your room. But you'll be so tired from walking round Rome, you probably won't even notice. :)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!! WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Lyle W
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel. This is a great location right near the train station. The staff was amazing. The room was better than advertised. The room was spacious and the breakfast was perfect. We missed the breakfast a few times because of early reservations but if you are able I would take your time to enjoy the morning meal. The price was right, the location was excellent and the service was great. Bed was comfortable. My only dislike was the noise level but that did not bother me as I am from New York and am used to the type of noise outside of our room. The noise is not something the hotel can really control, but its a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: bjaindt
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in June 2010 as a family with two college age daughters. We had the family suite which was the most spacious by far from anything we've ever stayed at in Europe. Nice breakfast each morning and convenient to all sites. The only time we took the subway was to the Vatican. The entry is SO European! Internet in lobby and wifi worked in rooms. We were there during the World Cup and the tv was tricky. Normally don't watch tv on vacation, so first time to comment on that. The back door was really close and handy to the street from our room. Would stay there again as a family or couple!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, decent room (great for Italy!), great value!”
Reviews.Author: 26kick
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Termini train station, totally walkable even with baggage. A map is a must if you're walking as it took us a while to get our bearings. Use the street address, it's not hard to find once you're on Nazionale. Staff was friendly and helpful. He made phone calls to help us get restaurant reservations (which were necessary!), which we could not have made ourselves. The room was small and the bathroom (particularly the shower) was too, but that was fine for us. Bigger people might have had a problem. Otherwise it was very clean! We've had other hotel experiences in Italy that were disappointing by American standards in terms of value but that was not the case here. The breakfast was nice and did not leave us wanting anything. The hotel is on the second floor of a building that is inset from the street, and it used to be a school building. An elevator exists but it is small, slow, and I think you need a key from the hotel. If you have heavy/lots of bags, definitely go ask before you lug 'em up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Italy Visit - Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jose2451
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Gea after a somewhat last minute vacation trip to Rome, and I needed a hotel close to the city AND Stazione Terminal. I like to stay close to the train station so I can walk to the hotel after I arrive and leave to my next location (Firenze). Hotel Gea was easy to find, walking distance and from Stazione Terminal. The hotel is centrally located at Via Nazionalle in Rome, minutes from Repubblica metro station (metro suggested for traveling to Vatican city) and walking distace from the Walk About bus tour departure location. The staff is friendly and helpfull. This is not a luxury hotel, but very accomodating for someone that has travel overseas before and is not looking to sleep all day in the hotel. The room had its own bathroom (shower, toilet) a large comfortable bed, wardrobe to store clothes and a breakfast area. It was a bit troubleshome to have to ring to get the door "buzzed" open late at night, but it's understood it is for security reasons. Everything was well and I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: GinetteandMichel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September. Close to the Termini train station, this hotel is located on Via Nazionale, from which it is very easy to walk to all the main attractions. However, our room # 30 was facing a very noisy side street. We think that the rooms in the other corridor might be quieter. The service was excellent & the room was extremely clean. The breakfast was very good & they even gave us a packed breakfast since we had to check out at 5:00am . Ginette & Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and Adequate facilities”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a double room. The welcome was perfect. They helped us with a beautiful map of Rome and suggested nearby restaurants for dinner. We were very apprehensive of its closeness to the infamous Termini station. We did not have any problem with safety and roamed in the streets till midnight. Piazza della repubblica is just round the corner and Trevi Fountain at 10 minutes walk. The rooms were clean even though they are a bit small. The bathroom was spacious with a small shower. The breakfast was great with croissants, cakes and yogurt. The staffs were friendly and warm. It is not a complete value for money, but adequately served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Bman32
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Gea. We were not surprised that we could not easily find the entrance, as we had read reviews previously. There are buzzers next to the large wooden door that must be pressed to gain entry. (B2 is the buzzer to press.) The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was spacious and clean with a mini-fridge. Loved the large bathroom, fully equipped with a hairdryer included. As usual in Europe, no washcloths in the bathroom. The wireless internet was flawless. The room didn't have much of a view, but the location was great for us, as we did a LOT of walking and we were in the heart of everything. Breakfast was included and was convenient and sufficient. We enjoyed fresh fruit, yogurt, juice and granola.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip in Rome (Pre Cruise and Post Cruise)”
Reviews.Author: MAGICK_HEX
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid-July before our cruise at Hotel Gea in the quad room located on the curved staircase area. The room was perfect for our needs and had a nice side entrance to quickly get to and from the sights and sounds of Rome. We arrived around 10:30AM after our long flight from Washington DC and were quickly greeted by a friendly face and taken to our room within 30 mins of arrival. Great attention to detail. This is a family run hotel and they made our stay in Rome very enjoyable. We are a family of four with two teenagers and the rooms are clean, large for European standards and the staff is great. If you need a hotel near the train station and walking distance to most sites this is a perfect location. We came back after our cruise and stayed an additional 5 nights in a larger quad around the corner. The room was huge and really an apartment rather than a hotel room. We will be back. As a note, there is a nice wine store less than 5 mins away along with a good gelato place. Restaurants are very good and close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Staff - Helpful and professional Room - Spacious, clean and exactly what we were after. Location - perfect. 10 minutes walk to the train station, 15 minutes walk to the colloseum, 15 minutes walk to the Pantheon etc ..... can not fault it. Breakfast (included) - good Shower - struggled a little with the lack of hot water M.

Reviews.Title: “Hot position nearby the railway station”
Reviews.Author: zambo335
Reviews.Content: Hot position nearby the railway station and a the very beginning of the main street (via Nazionale) heading to city center. tea and coffee boiler on the desktop; the bathroom was as small as the room, tv wall mounted had a wrong inclination so that you can't watch tv laying in bed, since my room was facing on the street I couldn't keep the window opened to breath while sleeping (I need it). I didn't like their continental breakfast since croissants and pastry were not well cooked but actually raw (may their oven didn't work well to unfreeze croissants). I expected a better room according to the photographs on the site but I anyway rate my overall staying positive because the hotel is in good central position and clean and smart.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for our perfect vacation of Italy!!”
Reviews.Author: ACRuzzi
Reviews.Content: After enjoying two weeks of traveling to many places in Italy.  We were absolutely happy to spend our final days in the most amazing city of Rome, and our stay at this Hotel made the experience even better.  It's within walking distance to a lot of major historical sites, and if you want to go to other areas like the Basilica, this hotel is a block away from the subway where you pay 1 Euro, and your there within 10 minutes or less.  There is also taxis that are at the Piazza Repubblica which the Hotel can call for you.  Which we used to go to the Fiumicino Airport for 40 Euro.  Or, if you would like to go other cities in Italy, Termini Train Station is also very close to this hotel. The hotel staff and management were an absolute pleasure to talk to, and were very helpful.  The rooms are very comfortable, air conditioned, clean, and well taken care of.  The continental breakfast is great.  The free Internet access worked very well with my laptop.  Best of all it was reasonably priced.  They treated us very well as a guest of their hotel, and they will make sure that you will enjoy your stay in Rome.  We stayed at this hotel over 10 years ago, and got the same service, and I would choose it again if I were to visit Rome for a third time.   Thanks again to Hotel Gea di Vulcano!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Hexanik
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviews referring me to this Hotel. This hotel was quite comfortable and reasonably priced and really helped with our travel budget. We got a quad as we were traveling with our 2 kids ages 10 and 7. The hotel was very great about handling our family and gave lots of help for navigating sites with only 3 days to spend in Rome. Please note there is an elevator for hotel guests but it is small!

Reviews.Title: “Central location. Clean, comfortable rooms and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SirCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were flying home through Rome after our 3 week trip to Europe. We chose to stay at the Hotel Gea di Vulcano for 1 our night in Rome after reading the other reviews here on Trip Advisor. We ended up settling on this hotel after weighing the price against other travellers' experiences. What clinched it for us was the lack of bad reviews. The hotel is very centrally located, about a 10 minute walk from the Termini train station. The check-in time was very early (12:30), so it suited our one-day tour plan perfectly. Finding the hotel is a bit of a trick, as it is located in a nondescript building and you have to buzz thorough a big ornate front door into a lobby and then through another gate into a courtyard before entering the building containing the hotel. Then, the hotel is up a couple of floors. We couldn't find out how to summon the elevator (it appeared to be locked), so we ended up walking up the stairs with our suitcases. In hindsight, you should probably tell the front desk clerk that you need the elevator when buzzing in the front door. Being our first time in Rome, we were a little bit worried about personal safety, especially near the train station. The hotel fronts onto a wide, well travelled and well lit street and we did not have any issues returning to the hotel later on in the evening. After checking in, the staff were very helpful, answering our questions and providing tips on what to see and how to get there. All the sights are easily walkable from the hotel; Ancient Rome, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain. Our room faced a side street, so it was quiet at all times. The room was much larger than we expected for Rome. The furniture and decor was basic, but adequate and comfortable. The windows opened right up and the air conditioning worked very well. The washroom was bright and clean; however, we found the shower stall quite cramped. There was no safe in the room, but the front desk had a large safe available with deposit boxes if you needed to lock up any valuables or important documents. Free wireless internet is included. The breakfast is nothing special, but Italians don't really do breakfast. A variety of juices, sticky sweet confections, yogurt, cereal, etc are available to guests. The coffee is great though! Overall, a solid pick for a stay in Rome. Perfect if you plan on spending most of your time out and about seeing the sights and enjoying what the city has to offer. The hotel is comfortable, convenient and reasonable value (for Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: i_like_mustard
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid I don't really know what the fuss is about with this hotel. I found it to be average at best. We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Rome and we really weren't impressed. The rooms seemed comfortable enough, but... - the noise from the street was really bad. - the maid came in to clean our room while we were at breakfast and we came back to find our room door wide open with all our valuables on show as the maid had left it unattended - we got locked out once because the intercom was not working - you don't get given a key for the gates - it was a bit like a building site when we went - new carpets were being put down - the hall smelled very strongly of detergent - the internet was temperamental It's saving grace I suppose was one very nice member of staff on reception who was really very helpful and gave us some good restaurant suggestions. Overall though, I'd have to say I probably wont be back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Good for short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Skittle54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and found the hotel to be clean and what we expected based on other reviews here. The hotel room was clean. Free wireless internet, limited television channels. Breakfast was included and was very good. Only complaints were that the water for shower never seemed to get very hot and the limited english spoken by the staff. The hotel is not located within walking distance of some of the attractions like Trevi fountain but is very near the metro, buses and the train station so this made it easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice amenities....”
Reviews.Author: MomeSanJuan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Via Nazionale, which is a major business/shopping area. It was a bit dificult to find at first, since you have to pass 3 entrances- ended up being safe... It is located in an apartment buliding. We were coming from the south of Italy by train, so we booked this hotel as it is located 10 min walk from Roma Termini station and the metro Plaza Republica. We booked a quad room, which ended being an apartment with 3 rooms - small living room, 1 room for our 2 teenagers, and 1 room for the couple. Very comfortable. The bathroom seemed to be recently remodelated, so everything was neat and spotless. We ended up not using the metro since we were able to walk to the Coliseum-- 15 min walk, and to other major attractions such as the Spanish steps (10 min walk) and Vatican City. Via Nazionale is full of restaurants, and shops and there are several bus stops- we did all by walking- but I mention that just in case. The hotel served a nice breakfast - not continental- fresh fruits, cereal, breads, ham etc.. and a great coffee. The staff was very nice and helpful. with maps, and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Romana DOC”
Reviews.Author: marcelolapa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Gea with my family. The room was quite small but it was cozy and clean. The breakfast was ok. The main feature is that the hotel is next to everything and you can actually go everywhere walking. Also, it stays a few minutes from Termini and from Metro. At last, you will be hosted by a careful and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smiggy1965
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel, it was perfect for the few days we stayed in Rome. It was really clean, breakfast was nice ,location really good.Staff were lovely. Would stay there again. We got the bus from the airport and the hotel was just a few mins walk away from the main station. Book with confidence and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: bvadvisor
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Gea di Vulcano. The hotel is walking distance from Termini (ask for exit where McDonald's is located outside) or Republica station - near Via Firenze and Via Napoli. Peek inside the huge main doors on busy Via Nazionale to find a beautiful, serene, picture-worthy entrance and walk up two short flights of stairs to get to hotel reception where you will be greeted by knowledgeable and pleasant staff (family owned). Our room was not ready for the early check-in we requested (approx. 20min wait), but there were comfortable sofas to sit on, access to internet and access to a clean bathroom while we waited. The room was truly worth the wait. Hotel room with 2 twin beds was larger than expected and washroom was huge - esp for European standards. Very clean room/washroom, sound-proof, ac worked extremely well, internet access and access to mini-bar with reasonable prices (used fridge to cool our drinks). Walking distance to cafes, restos, shops, market, metros, bus stops (4E day pass valid till midnight was definitely worth it). Easily visited tourist attractions by metro/walking and still had time to return to room when needed. We had supper at Antica Bohéme (4 Via Napoli). No outdoor terrace, but pictures of Italian celebrities who had dined there made this place feel like a hidden gem. Food was good, portions were large and good house wine was very cheap (6E for litre). They even have a menu for typical Rome dishes. You can take a train to the airport or have reception arrange shuttle service (pick up at entrance - approx. 30E for 2 people). For clean, comfortable rooms at an affordable price and great location, Hotel Gea di Vulcano is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Romford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Great staff, great location and a fantastic room. We had a room that overloked Via Napoli on level 1 and have never stayed in a room like it with barrel vaulted soffits. The breakfast is great with cereals, pastries, fresh fruits, yogurts, breads and cakes. More than adequate. The hotel is near Repubblica station on the metro and along Via Nazionale - easy to walk everywhere. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0323
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gea for 3 nights in May 2010. We arrived from the airport by train and it was an easy short walk to the hotel even with our huge backpacks. This hotel is not luxurious but it is clean, reasonably priced and comfortable. Just a nice, basic hotel. The staff was fantastic, very helpful and friendly at all times. We were able to easily walk EVERYWHERE from the hotel during our 3 days in Rome and on days when we ventured further than usual, it was nice to be close to the termini to be able to take the subway back if we needed a rest. The free breakfast was quite sufficient and the coffee was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you need to be near Termini, not for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: laparka
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a whirlwind Italian stopover enroute to elsewhere. Flew into Rome, immediately train to the north, then returned to Rome for just two nights & one day and I had to fly out on a Sunday morning. So I needed to be an easy distance from Termini, but I didn't want to be right at the station because I wasn't sure which streets in that neighborhood were OK and which were borderline sketchy. Given my situation this was absolutely the right choice for me in every possible way. A 5-10 min. walk from Termini to a very safe busy street, but the hotel is set back inside a courtyard so the noise is much less than you'd imagine for the location. Friendly staff, clean hotel, fantastic breakfast as others have commented. Good tv, comfortable bed, clean and functional shower if small, free wifi, what else do you need? The one thing I'd say, though, is that most neighborhood buildings are early 20th century, not really historic or picturesque, and the streetlife is for daytime shopping, not nighttime fun. There's a McDonalds a block away-- all you need to know about the area. At night people pass through to go somewhere else. So it simply does not have that magical Rome vibe for honeymooners or couples that you would get if you stayed above the Spanish Steps or near the Pantheon or in Trastevere or even 6-8 blocks further down in the heart of Monti. One or two OK restaurants right nearby but not in abundance and nothing special. Still, excellent value and pretty easy walking distance to absolutely everything, plus a metro stop right there.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rebircs
Reviews.Content: One of the few places in Rome I found to have free wi-fi (and a LAN computer you could use if needed). The staff was very helpful and very friendly -- the effort and attention to the little, extra things they did or had prepared to make my stay more welcoming and comfortable were noticed. The location was great; it very close to the major sightseeing locations and there were plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. I travelled by foot mostly, but I was within a block or two of both the metro and buses, which I took when my walking ventures wore me out. Also, I was not too far from the train station, which was convenient and inexpensive for getting to the airport. I stayed at one hotel in Rome before this one for about the same price, had the same star rating, and was somewhat nearby, and Hotel Gea di Vulcano was a much welcomed improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Tuia
Reviews.Content: + Lovely and helpful staff with good English skills + Superb location close to metro, Termini and all sights + Very clean and spacious room + No noise + In room: everything functioning well, tourist friendly adapter for electrical devices, good hairdryer, tv, water cooker and instant coffee/tea, excellent shower and bathroom, affordable minibar, beautifully decorated room, combined air-conditioner/heater works well and you can adjust it yourself! + Lovely breakfast 7-9:30 (-10 sat, sun) with cappuccino, tea, juice, toast, cheeses, prosciutto, yoghurt and mysli and cereals, apples, canned peaches and prunes, good selection on croissants and 2 types of cake + some others too that can't now remember. perfect kickoff for sighseeing! + Good internet connection at lobby (and free!) + We found a good guide book "Rick Steves' Rome 2010" on hotel library, and found 2 excellent restaurants and good better tour for Ostia Antica in it than in our guide (thanks to the person who put it there!) Only minor thing was that bed could have been softer, but that was not an issue, only matter of taste. Had plenty of sleep on 6 night stay. We will definitely return when going again to Rome, and will recommend to all friends too! Excellent value for your money! You'll notice the entrance when you search for a "striped" church on Via Nationale, hotel is just opposite of it. Or just check the Google Map with street view to recognize the place. Nighttime there is buzzer/door phone both on front door and for inside gate too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful hospitality, great value for price”
Reviews.Author: AryanaToronto
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend; - Excellent location. walking distance to anywhere worth going in Rome Center - Free wifi - Free breakfast: functional assortment of goodies for brkfst - Comfortable/clean room - Great hospitality - Safe (felt we were staying with friends) - excellent value for price Try dinner at Antica Boheme (suggested by the hotel)- the most amazing meal for great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel in perfect location to metro”
Reviews.Author: swingkid92677
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights pre cruise. It is in a perfect location, about two blocks from metro station near Piazza Republica and the hop on/ hop off bus stop. The rooms were extremely clean. Although small, they had a queen bed, two nightstands, and television with BBC news channel, private bathroom and lift. The bathroom shower was very small, but for what you needed it for, it was fine. The hotel offers free breakfast with homemade croissants, breaks, coffee, juice, cheese, etc. It was a great start to the day. They also have free wifi in the rooms and computer in lobby for guests to use. The staff was sweet and helpful, charged accurate billing and provided a relaxed first time Roma experience. We would absolutely stay here again. I am sure there are nicer hotels with better amenities, but the hotel is clean and in good location. When in Rome, we planned to be out of the hotel most the day and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: LTML
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gea from 10/31-11/04/10. There were three of us, our 12 year old daughter, my husband and myself. When we told a freind who travels to Rome often where we were staying she told us it was her favorite place and shortly after arriving we understood why. The room was exactly as pictured on line the hotel was fantastic the location was amazing and all the staff were wondeful. They were very helpful and accomodating. The value was fantastic. We were certainly be returning to this hotel the next we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mh1618
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here at the beginning of our Italian getaway. We had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We lucked out and got the apartment in the back, so we had three rooms all to ourselves. It was so nice having two separate bedrooms and a sitting room! The bathroom was adorable, the rooms were clean, beds were no more or less comfortable than anywhere else we stayed- but we didn't have to share beds there, which was a huge bonus. Breakfast was included, as well, which was a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RowleyEssex
Reviews.Content: Great location for both train station and all major city sites. Staff very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Met all expectatiosn and pretty good value for a city centre hotel

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SKapoor2010
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend the hotel enough. I enjoyed one of the friendliest, warmest service I have ever encountered. The location is pretty central in terms of sightseeing. And the Repubblica Metro being barely minutes away is pretty handy, too. The single room was tiny though expected. The daily room cleaning was good, the breakfast adequate. The free wifi in the room was very appreciated. But the most remarkable feature of the hotel is the friendliness of the staff, especially Francesca. I'd stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, could be better”
Reviews.Author: Dustoff_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our trip to Italy. First time we had a small double room. The room was OK but the bathroom was extremely small even by Europe's "everything is small" standards. The shower stall was like a vertical coffin, hardly any room to soap yourself without injuring your elbows or hitting the faucet handle and flooding yourself with gasping cold water or burning hot scalding water (both of which happened to me). Second time, perhaps to make it up to us they gave us a surprisingly large 3 room suite which was good. That raised the question why two levels of rooms for the same price. Like everyone has noted, this hotel is hard to find. I was able to tell my taxi driver the right location only because I had made a dry run with Google maps :) This hotel is in a great location just 2 blocks from the Repubblica metro stop and 10 minutes walk from Roma Termini. It is also close to the Colosseum and all the other central Rome attractions. The staff are very warm and friendly. This is one more of those family run hotels which shares space in a building with another hotel, offices, etc. The main door off Via Nazionale closes every weekday at 11 AM and is closed on weekends. There is a small side door entrance off Via Napoli. This hotel is OK. I would suggest also checking out other hotels along the Via Nazionale before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a large quad room.”
Reviews.Author: j_kDad2266
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gea provided us with a very large quad room that was very affordable. The room was actually three different rooms (two separate bedrooms) plus a large bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was very good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Located within a few blocks of Repubblica Plaza, it was very easy to walk or take the metro to most of the favored sites, and the taxi was fairly inexpensive to the Piazza Navona area. We’d quickly book this room again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: KarenQ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this family-run hotel on our first visit to Rome with our two young girls aged 5 and 7. The front office staff was exceptional and so helpful, friendly and accommodating (especially Francesca, the owner's daughter). What surprised us most was the enormous accommodation we were given. It was like having our own luxury apartment! The 4 rooms were a welcome relief after traipsing through a busy and hot Rome. The rooms and bathrooms were beautifully clean and well equipped. The hotel is also well positioned and close to the main transport routes. All in all, an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, huge quad room”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the beginning of our trip and another night at the end. The hotel is in a convenient location just down the street from Piazza Repubblica. We came out of Termini from the wrong door, however, and it took us forever to find since Rome is short on street signs. I was very glad I had the pictures to go by, they helped me recognize it when we finally found it. We had reserved a quad room for the first night, and it was enormous! A suite of four large rooms with a huge bathroom, and great A/C -- we were in heaven. It's on a busy street but the windows shut out the noise nicely. The front desk staff spoke very good English and were very friendly, and the computer with internet in the lobby was nice to have as we weren't carrying a laptop. When we returned at the end of our trip, we were assigned a smaller quad room (#38) which wasn't quite as nice, since one of the beds was a lumpy sofabed, but still fairly large with two separate rooms. Breakfast was adequate and the breakfast lady was really nice too. My mom had a single room (same as double) which was quite nice also. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mrspaper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gea, pre-cruise. Many people we were on Cruise Critic with, also stayed at the hotel, which was convenient for a bus to take us to the ship the next day. Upon arrival, it was a bit difficult to find the hotel. The shuttle dropped us off in front of the hotel, we saw the name, but had to ask people where it was. Be warned that the woman who sits in a booth in front of the group of homes, and hotels, locks the door at 11 am on the weekends, and by 7 pm every evening. In the eve, in pouring rain, we passed the hotel a few times because we didn't know the door was locked, as it was a bit before 7 pm. We were warned that their was a door on the side of hotel, but we couldn't find that either. We persevered, and found our way. Carry the phone # with you, just in case. Once we found our way into the hotel, we were confused how to find our way to it. It shares space with apartments, etc. When you arrive from the street, go through the covered walkway. When you see the fountain, it is the door to the left of the fountain. Walk up a flight of stairs to the elevator. If no one is there with a key, walk up one more flight to the hotel, and go down the elevator, for your luggage. You can fit 2 pieces of luggage with one person, on the elevator. We found the beds a bit too firm and our backs hurt in the am There was internet for guests in the lobby, but it was very slow There are no safes in the room. I wasn't sure about trusting them to the passports, etc, but I gave in, as I didn't want to go out with them. Everything was fine. They have a safe where they put your belongings. Francesca at the front desk was a sweetheart and very helpful. She went out of her way to make sure things were good and she was very helpful when it came to our transporatation the next day, the bus pulling up in front, and all the extra people who were meeting at our hotel. the woman who sits in the booth in the front of the hotel, doesn't permit noise or loitering, especially with luggage. Francesca insured that everyone came up to the hotel to wait for the bus. Breakfast was good. Restaurants nearby for dinner were also good. The hotel is located in a convenient area

Reviews.Title: “not fancy but nice”
Reviews.Author: SueC1
Reviews.Content: We needed a triple room for just one night in Rome. We were pleased with this hotel; location was good, room was good sized altho the bathroom was just average, the third bed was a "real bed", and I thought the price was very reasonable for a triple. The prettiest part of the hotel is the fountain they show on the website - the rest was pretty plain but comfortable enough. I'd stay there again, esp. if a short stay or one that would be including day trips out of Termini. I've been ripped off by the cab drivers there often enough to prefer to be able to walk to my hotel!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but good value”
Reviews.Author: thezman74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my girlfriend. Hotel is very small, just 1 floor, but provided everything you need. Room was decent size and clean with a pretty comfortable bed, lobby had free internet, and breakfast was simple but acceptable. Location was good also- close to metro stop and close to termini station (great for day trips on trenitalia)., and the front desk tried to help as best they could. Was a little expensive at Eoro 125/night, but that seemed to be the average price for smaller hotels when we were there. We were happy with the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value, price and location!”
Reviews.Author: oakish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 33 for one night, which was next to a stairwell and lift. Having just come in from the USA, I had no problem sleeping through the occasional lift noise. The free wi-fi unfortunately did not extend to our room that evening – no problem, I used my laptop in the reception area. The room itself was great! We wanted two twins and were given a room with a double bed and a tiny little second room with a twin. The bathroom was huge. The whole facility was very clean and well maintained. The receptionists were very nice. Located just a few blocks from Termini made it extremely convenient. The breakfast offered was a perfect start to the day. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto”
Reviews.Author: mitsupilot
Reviews.Content: A really nice 3 star hotel in Rome! The hotel is situated on the Via Nazionale, approx. 5 minutes to walk from the metro station Repubblica (Line "A"), and 10 minutes from Fontana di Trevi - easy to find. Big, clean rooms with a snug design (and our bathroom was the biggest from all rooms) and a helpful staff. The breakfast is a little bit more, than a typical italian breakfast, and absolutely OK to get some energy for the daily trip. Our windows are not faced to the main street (Via Nazionale), that's why we slept well. Pharmacy and supermarket: only 2 minutes. Parking: opposite of the restaurant by the night entrance the parking garage at the Villa Borghese. The wireless internet is included in the room price or use the computer in the lobby. You may try the restaurant next to the night entrance ("Il Barocco"), almost the service is quite slow and the men are not the best waiters of the world, but their kitchen is very delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Best cappuccino”
Reviews.Author: Kapellbruecke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and I have the best cappuccino in its breakfast room in Italy. The room is spacious and clean. The location is great and there are many restaurants around. Local attractions can be easily accessed by foot or metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: OnTour_10
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the main railway station. Very central for touring on foot. Room small but clean with nice decor. Very helpful and friendly staff. Free wireless internet in the room. Good value all round.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and in the city center.”
Reviews.Author: Tyler0105
Reviews.Content: Flying from Germany to Rome was made simple. We flew in, took the train to the main Termini station, and then only walked two blocks before arriving here. So the location was perfect for our trip. Just north of the Piazza Venezia, and a short walk for a young couple! We did have a few gripes about the hotel though. Firstly, we arrived and were told that we didn't have a room (even though I personally called 2 days prior). They found our reservation after I showed the print-out that I had brought.... no problem, simple mistake. They then brought us to a room that was outside of the main hotel! It was a room straight off of the back staircase to the hotel, below the Breakfast room. We first thought that this was nice and romantic... but as our week went on, it was increasingly annoying to walk all the way out and around the building in order to get to the front desk again. And after hours was even more complicated as they shut the front doors to the courtyard. So that was a bit annoying. Aside from that, the noise was a bit disturbing. The windows were not sealed very well, and were right off of a main road, so the sounds of cars and people yelling went on early into the morning. We were able to sleep and essentially ignore it, but if we were an older couple we probably would want a quieter room in the actual hotel. We had a wonderful time overall, and love finding small hotel gems in Europe.... though we probably won't stay here again, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small gem in the center of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mellon
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Gea the night before flying back to the U.S. The Gea is not fancy, but it is clean, the staff are friendly, and the location could not be better. It is a short walk to the train station, good restaurants, and numerous attractions. There is also free Internet in the lobby for hotel guests. If you plan to stay in your hotel room all day (and why would you?), then you will likely be happier in a hotel with more amenities; however, the Gea is just fine when compared to other hotels in Rome. The front desk clerk assured that we had the quickest and most efficient transportation to the airport in the morning. Instead of taking the Leonardo Shuttle, she arranged for a cab to take us to the airport for 10 Euros less. This was a nice touch and very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: We_L0ve_Italy
Reviews.Content: excellent location, walking distance from the Termini. Typically small Rome rooms, but clean. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome, I would recommend this hotel to travellers”
Reviews.Author: lisdonwilly
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for a long weekend at the end of September 2009. It was our first stay in Rome and we found it very convenient and a great stay. We made getting to the hotel difficult for ourselves, walking about 1 mile past the hotel. The staff were friendly and approchable and best of all for us spoke fluent English. We found the location of the hotel very convenint to the metro and a lot of the main sites in Rome. We didn't use any public transport once we got to the hotel as it was very central. The hotel has a restauraunt downstairs which was pretty good and had an Irish bar across the street. I was concerned about some people mentioning noise but the windows were very sound proof and if you closed the window properly there was very little noise in the room. The hotel sits just off a busy street in a good area of Rome. The continental breakfast was very good, albeit that I would prefer a fry. The room service was also very good and I even had clothes folded away that I had left lying around the room. The hotel has free wifi and a laptop in Reception with free internet connection. In all I could not fault this hotel and would definately book it if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: traveller4245
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near Termini station. FCO airport is 30 mins by express train and will cost you 11 euro per person. Local attractions can be easily accessed by foot or metro. Staff is wonderful and pleasant. Rooms are spacious & clean. I had reserved the room through bookings.com and everything was perfect. The hotel even accommodated my request for early check-in and 2 beds, which were ready upon my arrival. Access to wi-fi from hotel room was an added bonus. On my first trip to Rome, I had stayed at a busy 4-star hotel located on the same street - smaller rooms, line-ups to check-in/out, staff not always available to answer your questions. I definitely preferred my stay at Hotel Gea di Vulcano. It's a great place to relax after long days of sightseeing. One thing to note: elevator is very small. If you travel with lots of luggage, you may find this an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: betsmith38
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gea was our last hotel in our three-week trip to Italy with our two granddaughters (ages 19 and 17) and it was just lovely. The building had been a former school a hundred or so years ago and it looked like the rooms inside were all new and remodeled. It was very close to everything, we walked to the Trevi Fountain our first evening (although we like to walk!), but it was very close to the Metro so very convenient. (I would recommend you buy a Roma Pass 25 euros, as it totally paid itself off with all transportation paid for, plus two major attractions paid for, no waiting in lines and discounts for other attractions). The reception staff was wonderful (spoke English), there was free internet, a marvelous breakfast, they took care of a cab for our ride to the airport and were helpful in every way. In the entryway of the hotel is a marvelous fountain (see photo) and the room service provided linens, of course, plus shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, etc. We were very, very happy with our stay at the Hotel Gea.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateLockett
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel with really easy access from both Termini station and to all the sights. Even in the August heat with all of our luggage it was less than 20 minutes to walk from the station. All the main sights were also easily walkable to. Lovely rooms with good airconditioning and well equipped bathrooms. Showers were very good and by Italian standards a good size. Would stay there again if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: rachtn05
Reviews.Content: Booking a hotel in Rome can be mind boggling. After looking at many sites, I finally decided on the Hotel Gea. It was close to the metro station, close enough to termini to walk but also not in the shady area right next to it. My mother and I were traveling alone but felt secure inside at night. A little hike, but also within walking distance to the Colosseum. Rooms were clean. Breakfast, ok. The room we stayed in was actually larger than what we booked for no extra charge. Staff was extremely nice and very helpful. They gave us directions to the sights and maps. Also had a computer with free internet for use in the lobby. I would stay there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Peens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Gea for 3 nights on our last leg of our Italian Honeymoon. I searched up and down for a low priced hotel that fit our bill and well, this was it! We were not disappointed! Trust me! Locataion: well situated, 5 minutes from Termini station, and pretty much 10 to 15 minutes walking distance to everything else. Loaded with shops, restaurants, taxis, etc. Rooms: big (go figure), very clean, airy, good shower pressure, lots of hot water, nice soaps, etc. The hotel has a lift so no problem hauling heavy luggages up to your floor. Breakfast, just perfect, hot cappucinos, sweet rolls, cereal, fruit, juices, etc. Staff: Spoke English, very friendly, very helpful, and accomodating. About 3 mins from the hotel is a beautiful square, that's were we took out Hop On Hop Off tour bus, just perfect! Book here, save the extra money and go shopping in Bella Roma as we did...!!! We recommend this hotel - no problem...!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Service - Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: lkwhitlock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome for 3 days. I found this hotel on Tripadvisor. It was a good price and included breakfast. The location was fantastic. It was within 1/2 mile of Termini Station, easy walk. The room was nice size, had everything you needed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was nice and there were quite a few choices. Definately would recommend to anyone and return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful staff made our stay perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sleep7
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a week long trip to Italy and we stayed at the Hotel Gea for 2 nights. Months ago I had emailed them and I booked a family "apartment" for the amazing price of only 190 Euros/night including breakfast and taxes. I only have positive things to say about this hotel. First the apartment we booked was huge with a sitting area, 2 bedrooms and one bathroom. We are 2 adults and 3 children and we had tons of room to spread out. Second of all I loved the location. It's on Via Nazionale about 2 blocks south of Piazza della Repubblica. It's only a 5 - 10 minute walk from the train station and that was very convenient. There was a supermarket 2 blocks away on Via Nazionale heading the other direction. It was about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps and about a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum. What really set this hotel apart was the friendliness and the charm of the staff. When we arrived we were greeted by Francesca and she cheerfully showed us our room and that if you book the apartment you have a separate entrance on the side street. Then later that night another lovely and helpful woman Alessandra helped us to choose a restaurant for dinner and was so warm and welcoming that it really made you glad you booked this hotel. Not to be forgotten was the woman who served the breakfast in the morning. She didn't speak any English and I don't speak any Italian but we smiled a lot at each other and she was so nice as to give me a tray to bring back some breakfast food to our sleeping children in our room. There is a computer in the lobby that was rarely busy and the guests were welcome to use it. If you bring your laptop you can use their wireless internet in the lobby too. The day before we left Francesca arranged for a cab to come for us and Alessandra stored our luggage for us during the day after we checked out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It was a totally positive experience and a very good value too!

Reviews.Title: “On busy street..but”
Reviews.Author: CarolinIN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gea is on a busy street..and there was lots of noise. The AC didn't work correctly and we had to keep the windows open and at night and early morning the noise was somewhat disturbing. The breakfast provided was very good. Plenty of choices, and good variety. Pleasant staff. Helpful for the most part. We were able to access our personel email at a computer in the lobby. It was within walking distance to Termini which was good. This was my first trip abroad so I have nothing to compare to...but all in all..a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: nurse1Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Hotel Gea and it was as good as the first. My daughter and I were travelling together and the size of our room was great with a beautiful big bathroom. The breakfast each morning (included in the room price) was a great start to the day. The front desk staff were friendly and spoke great English. The use of a computer to send emails was also great. This hotel is easily within walking distance of almost any place you want to go to in Rome, is close to a metro station and has great shopping and restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could expect from Italian warmth and charm!”
Reviews.Author: biggyboy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading good reviews from tripadvisor and venere.com and were simply happy with everything. The location of the hotel is in the heart of Rome where you have everything you need on the same street such as a gelato stand, a supermarket, restaurants, boutiques, pharmacies, cafes, churches, fruit stands, and even a McDonald's (if you really miss it). Also within close walking distance is Termini train station and not too far off are all the many monuments such as Trevi fountain and the Colliseum. Francesca at the front desk made us feel at home from day one! Thank you for your warmth and excellent service! She and Maximo at the desk made each of our 4 days stay here truly special from their restaurant recommendations to their personal suggestions of where to find certain things. The room was simply gorgeous! The charm of the room including the floor tiles were stunning and the size was unexpectedly large. We had a large queen/king bed and an extra alcove that had a separate single bed for our 4 yr old child with its own cabinet. There was a small stocked mini-ref and a large bathroom with shower and small coffee table and chair. Very clean, spacious and quiet since it was on the 2nd floor and facing the inner part of the hotel/courtyard. (Included pics with this review). The neighborhood was very safe and we enjoyed strolling even late at night with our child. The hotel has a very small sign up front (easy to miss) and is located on the first floor inside a little charming building compound (1st floor in Europe is 2nd floor for us in the US) and although there is no wireless access in the rooms, they have it in the lobby and also have a laptop for guest use. They close the front door at night so you have to take the side entance on the side street but it was no incovenience at all. Overall, we think we have found a hotel that we will keep coming back to in the future when we are in Rome. Their family-friendly service, excellent location, spacious comfy and cozy rooms with character, all translate into great value in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beanoz
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via trip advisor and totally agree with all the positive reviews- the rooms were clean, quiet and well-presented, the location was great and the breakfast was very good. The staff were very polite and helpful and recommended what ended up being one of our favourite restaurants in Europe. A great stay. The shower was small, as mentioned by a previous reviewer, but really, who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Doodlebug37
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, good situation, excellent staff - friendly and helpful. The room was large and well fitted. Bathroom looked new with excellent shower. Very good breakfast though the need to have BOILING water for tea is not really understood here, or at any of the cafes in Rome we went to. Good coffee though. The room was very clean and sheets changed 3 times tho' we were there only 5 nights. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the bedrooms. We had to be at Termini Station by 7.20 on the morning we left and they arranged for us to help ourselves to breakfast at 6.30. The hotel is 10-15 mins walk from Termini Station. We'd stay here again if we ever have the chance to go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bring the ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: aussieboy7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in October. Reception held our bags as our room wasn't ready. Room was nice - everything you could expect in a good hotel room, the only thing we thought was unusual was that the tea and coffee formed part of the mini-bar and you had to pay for it if you wanted it. The size of the room was good. Large entry, bathroom was huge, although the shower was quite small. Wasn't a problem and was average size by European standards. Breakfast was great with selections of cereals, breads, fruits, coffee, juices, toppings etc. The only problem overall was the noise. The street noise was extremely loud and I had to wear ear plugs two of the three nights which took the edge off it. The sirens went most of the night and you could hear the conversations of the people below echoing up. Other than that, everything was good, and the service was good. Great location for sights and for the stops of the hop-on-hop-off tour (recommend doing this - great value for getting around the city sightseeing for two days).

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night & found it very enjoyable. It was convenient to sites, shopping, trains, etc. A very comfortable room, old but clean & neat & great value for money compared to other Rome accomodation. Would definately stay there again! +++++++++++ Joe.S

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prettypacific
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Gea for 3 nights during our stay in Rome. The perks: 1. easy walk from the train station (15 mins) 2. good size room 3. good location (on a busy street, but cannot hear the noise from the room) 4. free breakfast buffet (enough to fill you until lunch) 5. laptop with free internet in the lobby 6. clean 7. prompt service-- when we were having issues with our TV and shower head, the man who was working at the front desk came and fixed them right away. The issues: 1. The bed we had was clearly sagging on one side. Though it didn't cause us to lose sleep, it would have been good for the hotel to replace the bed as it was clearly sagging, even when we weren't on it. 2. The hair dryer in our room worked, but when I lifted it to turn it on, the cord detached from the base (easier to imagine when you know what their hair dryer looks like). Someone had clearly broken it prior to our arrival and tried to hide it. 3. The shower head in our bathroom was too heavy for the base. It was one of those shower heads that could be hand held, but in this case, it had to be hand held because the weight of it kept bending the holder over.... Overall, for the rate of 100 euros per night, it was a comfortable stay. Not sure if I would rush to stay here again, but did not feel like it was a waste... If you're looking for a basic hotel in Rome, this would be a good place. After all, you wont be spending much time in your hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: mozwold
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic 3star hotel on one of the main streets in Rome. It's a ten minute walk to Termini, 2 mins to Piazza Republica, 10-15 mins to Trevi fountain and Spagna. The accomodation was excellent: we had the mini suite on the mezanine floor close to the rear exit which was perfect for our needs. It was spacious, spotless (and kept that way), and the bathroom was great. Breakfast is not a feast, but is above average by Roman standards. Rome is not a cheap place to visit, but this is as close as you'll get to value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for my family of 5”
Reviews.Author: mela1963
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Romeby.com. We were given a room/apartment which consisted of a good size bathroom, 3 rooms/2 tvs/air conditioning and a separate entrance on a side street. This was great for my family of 2 adults and 3 children. paid Eur200 pernight which included breakfast. The location is within walking distance to train station and most attractions. Area has quite a few shops and restaurants. The staff were very friendly. A little hard to find as the street numbers are over the place. The rooms were clean and for the price we paid was more than happy. Do not expect 5 star amenities ie room service/internet/etc but you are not paying 5 star either.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right distance from Termini rail station”
Reviews.Author: buckislove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just the right distance from Termini train station, too close to the station is not a good neighborhood, but this is about a 10 minute walk and is about 10-15 minutes walk from the main ancient attractions along Via Nazionale. It is on the 2nd floor of a large building, and you pass a beautiful little fountain with goldfish to get to the stairs up to the hotel. They had a great breakfast in a small room each morning, but it was delicious and filling. The hotel is, blessedly, air conditioned for those hot Rome days. The room was spacious, even though the bathroom was on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, location great, ideal”
Reviews.Author: saemi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms were nice although bathroom small (not uncommon in italy, especially Rome). Location was ideal, right on VIa Nazionale, walking distance to everything... restaurants, museums, sights, etc. The staff was extra friendly, helped us with a number of bookings and made our honey-moon just an extra bit special. Recommend to anyone who would like to stay in a nice hotel, nice location, and at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RossiTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gea di Vulcano for 3 nights. We were pleasantly surprised by it. The room was actually one of the biggest ones on our trip. Very clean and comfortable with a good sized bathroom. Breakfast was better than in our bed and breakfast in Florence. Location was perfect. Via Nazionale is a major street that has buses running up and down so it was easy to just hop on and off. It was also a walking distance from the termini station but not very close. We felt safer there than in some parts of Chicago lets just say. The staff was VERY helpful – especially with helping us getting our pack back from the airport. (AA lost our pack on a direct flight to Rome – can you imagine?). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ErraticTuscan
Reviews.Content: I usually go to Rome for work and stay in 4stars chain hotel. Recently I had the chance to spend a weekend in Rome with my girlfriend and just wanted something different than business or too touristy hotels. After browsing the internet I decided for Vulcano di Gea. I was surprised for the value I got. For the price of a 2stars hotel you get a 4stars accommodation. We paid around 130 euro per night and we were given a two bedrooms apartment with private entrance, living room and a spotless nice bathroom. OK, maybe we were just lucky and this in not what you usually get but our two nights stay were just fantastic. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those looking for the best possible value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gea di Vulcano for four nights. Our room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was tiny but fine. The rest of the hotel was decorated nicely and the breakfast was decent. I found the location to be very convenient. Via Nazionale is a busy street with several bus stops. It's close to Termini and not too far from ancient Rome. We walked from the train station with our luggage and didn't find it to be too bad. My only complaint is that the hotel didn't have wireless internet. In this day and age I don't think there is an excuse for not having it. Fortunately, there was an internet point across the street. In general I found the hotel to be comfortable and affordable and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for our stay”
Reviews.Author: elleandpea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gea di Vulcano for 3 days on our recent trip to Rome. We were very pleasantly surprised by it. We arrived late, after a hair-raising taxi trip from the airport, and were greeted by friendly patient staff who then showed us to our delightful room, a small suite half way up a spiral staircase. It was a wonderfully spacious, clean and well appointed room. We even had access to the back entrance to the hotel at the foot of the staircase. We found the hotel to be perfectly positioned for us. We walked everywhere so the proximity of public transport was not really an issue for us, but it is on the via Nazionale which is a major arterial route with buses constantly moving up and down. The hotel was older but clean and the staff helpful and well informed. The only small negative comment would be about the size of the breakfast room, however this did not really bother us as we ate breakfast out most days. We found it great for our purposes and good value for a hotel so handy to the sites of Rome and the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and Great Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: Maidstone7
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I just got back from our European vacation and this was our first stay on the trip. Great staff that were very accomodating. Wonderful location. We walked from the Termini Train station to our hotel. Not a bad haul at all. Breakfast was served every morning with a wonderful array of fruits, pastries and great coffee! The two ladies who ran the breakfast room were very sweet. Bathroom was great. We were sad not to have a tub, but didn't mind taking showers. It was a nice size bathroom. All in all it was excellent. We absolutely loved Rome and would definitely go back to tour more sites. There are so many! And this hotel is great for hopping on the metro or catching a cab. Or just walking around the city! Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Large, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl247
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gea is a wonderful, comfortable place to stay. The room was beautifully furnished with lovely artwork and drapery. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very modern and new. The carpet in the room was plush and felt great on our tired feet. We found the receptionists at the desk extremely helpful and knowledgable. They gave us a detailed map of the area, and recommended restaurants, and tour companies to use. There are safe deposit boxes at the front desk available for use, a breakfast that is included in the room rate, and a hairdryer in the bathroom. Overall, a comfortable, modern hotel in an ancient city.

Reviews.Title: “A real delight”
Reviews.Author: indigogirl1
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on reviews and wasn't disappointed. We arrived late at night to a very friendly receptionist who showed us to a lovely room that was spotless, with new furnishings and carpets, really tasteful and just the perfect comfort you need on a city break. Our room , no 24, was massive and the other rooms we saw being cleaned were a bit smaller but still all lovely. THe breakfast was great in a nice little breakfast room with fresh pastries, cereals, cakes, parma ham, cheese, toast, youghurt , fruit, juices and freshly made hot drinks. Can set you up for the day. The location is also excellent, just 10 minutes from the station but in a really smart street - the hotel is the first floor of a building. we managed to walk from there to everywhere but the metro is 5 minutes away if you're not up to walking. Really can't fault this hotel ....go there !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: marden
Reviews.Content: A great hotel if you like clean well-priced accomodation. We enjoyed our one night stay here. The restaurant downstairs was great. Breakfast was fine and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: family5Toronto
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels that we stayed in during our 3 weeks in Europe. It was definitely the BEST considering the price. We were a family of 5 and we stayed for 3 nights. We stayed in the 3 room family suite which was very large, very clean and updated,and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was well situated. We had our own private entrance off the street. I would highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: VaniaAustralia
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a magical trip to Italy. The purpose of our trip was to meet up with long lost Italian relatives and to introduce them to our girls. We also decided to have a 4 night stay in Rome. Thanks to the "Trip Advisor" website and reader reviews ,we found the most exquisite little hotel called Gea di Vulcano. I booked a quad room for the 4 of us and was utterly blown away with the 3 bedroom appartment which greeted us - all this for no extra cost. With 2 teenage daughters, it was heaven having our own rooms, furnished with antiques and a TV. Bathroom was beautifully tiled and very clean. Breakfast is very substantial - cereal, toast, waffles, fruit, yogurt, biscuits, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Staff were very kind and helpful and didn't complain when my husband broke the card attached to the key for the room. Location is superb - close to all the wonderful shops, walking distance to the Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Ftn, Colosseum. Metro is a 2 min walk and very easy to use. Only complaint was the excessive noise from the window. Our room faced a side street and unfortunately, you could hear the conversations of people below. After a while though, once sleep set in, we all slept like babies. We arrived in Rome at Termini Station and walked to the hotel - 10 min walk. We did find Rome very expensive for eating. One night we ate pizza downstairs in Via Napoli and the following night we discovered a supermarket and bought bread rolls, proscuitto, fruit and panettone(Yummy Italian cake)Very, very handy location,We would definitely return to the Gea if we come to Rome again and would very, very highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: kiwisahoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 07. Walked from main train station with suitcases and found it easy to find. Room large and all very clean and tidy. Great little restaurant on side street beside exit/night entrance door. Found it very simple to get to bus station/train station and the area was alot nicer than straight around the cnr of stn etc. Will stay again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Basic”
Reviews.Author: JonandKarin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend city break to Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Gea Di Vulcano. The hotel is clean and quiet given its location on Via Nationale, however its a little bit tired in places (i.e. thinning carpets, old and grubby sofa bed presumably for families). Beware ... The pictures on the hotel website make it look much nicer than it actually is. That said, it offers pretty good value for money for those wanting to enjoy the city rather than their bedroom. Would we stay there again? Not sure, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Quality accommodation at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Robert07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights as a family group and were very impressed. The rooms were a good size and were clean and well presented. There were no tea/coffee facilities so take your own. Only one English channel on the TV was a bit of a drawback but there was a reasonably priced minibar. Yes, the breakfast arrangements are a little strange. We were more concerned about lack of space in the tiny dining room rather than lack of food! For the money this hotel is an undoubted bargain. Handily located on the Via Nazionale it is easily walkable to the station for connections to the airport. Many of the sights were within walking distance and a metro stop was nearby for longer trips. Be aware though that the main entrance is closed most of the day on weekends as well as at night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: grannysontour
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something different, try the Hotel Gea di Vulcano. You will not walk in the lobby through the usual rotating glass doors but by pressing the inconspicuous security button which opens the heavy wooden door on the footpath - not the entrance you are expecting. Once inside, the hotel is delightfully furnished with personal service. Although there is a small lift, be prepared for stairs. If you have a family, ask for the 3 bedroom apartment, it is exquisite. The location is excellent for exploring Rome on foot and for taking the Metro. An unusual hotel, well worth a stay for just a few or several days

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Our suite was HUGE!”
Reviews.Author: ccalavitta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. We paid 150 euro for the suite and it was HUGE by European standards - an amazing deal in the heart of Rome and PERFECT for families since the kids can have their own bedroom without disturbing mom and dad in their separate bedroom. Staff was very nice and helpful. My only negative comment (and it is very minor) is that the espresso was a bit weak in the morning (made from one of those push-button machines) - so skip the hotel coffee and instead go take it like the locals - at the bar at your favorite cafe. All in all, this hotel rocked! We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasBride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with various family members last month. We were in Rome for a brief stop before going to Tuscany for our wedding. Our luggage was lost and the front desk was excellent about calling the airport and trying to find it. The hotel also sent my wedding dress out to be steamed. The service was excellent. Our room was clean and large. The hotel is on a busy street, but we had very little street noise. The breakfast isn't that great, but there are plenty of coffee shops in the area. The location is good. It's not central, but it's close to a bus stop and a subway stop. It's also a quick cab ride to anywhere else in Rome. It's within walking distance of the Colloseum, but most of the other attractions would be a very long walk. We did have some minor issues due to flights being cancelled. We had to cancel three rooms, and the hotel let us pay for two of them and took the other room off our bill. I understand this because it would be difficult for them to book that room with just a day's notice. However, when we later asked about using one of the rooms we were paying for, the hotel refused to let us use it. We were mildly upset by this, but the hotel's service in other areas made up for this one issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cynde
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed with our teenage son at Gea. We were in the suite which would easliy accomodate 4 adults. It had 2 bedrooms and small livingroom/sitting area and a large bathroom that was immaculate and newly renovated. Both bedrooms had airconditioning units which worked very well in the 90+ degree Rome weather we had. The location worked well. Everyone says its close to Termini...but it is actually closer to the Republicca area (opera)...much nicer area than Termini. A short stroll up Via Nazionale to the Republicca metro stop and you can get anywhere in the City. We felt very safe traveling on the Metro from this location and took it to the Vatican (San Pietro) and also to Termini to transfer to the blue line to the Colliseum, Forum, Palantine Hill etc.... You can walk to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon if you put on your walking shoes or take a taxi. If you are taking the train out of Termini Station, or picking up a car like we did...you can either walk the 10 minutes up to the top of Via Nazionale then take a right, walk a few minues and you will see Termini or take a short cab ride or take the metro one stop to Termini. The only place to be extra careful is at Termini...my husband stopped a thief from stealing a businessman briefcase while standing in the Avis Car rental line. Just always be aware of whats going on at all the busy sites....even at the Vatican! Breakfasts were good, and they did have limts on toast and cappucinos, but there is plenty of good croissants and roles and juice, etc...that it was not an issue for us. We used the via Napoli entrance for the suite, which is the side street to the left if you are facing the front of the building on Via Nazionale. The door is just before the Gelato Shop and has a little brass sign with a buzzer. They will buzz the door open if you announce yourself. Overall a good choice for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler_0000
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Gea for two nights in May, 2007, and enjoyed our stay. PROS: -spacious and quiet room. I don't *think* the hotel has any rooms on busy Via Nazionale, and our room was very quiet (when the window was closed). Bathroom was huge (for Europe). -close to Termini station. We just walked to the hotel from the station upon our arrival, and it was a quick 5 min walk back to the station to catch the express train to the airport two days later. -great breakfast. I'm a huge muesli fan, so any place that goes beyond the standard croissant fare and give you cereal is OK in my book. We were somewhat put off by the strict "breakfast quantity limits" that were handed to us at check-in and also posted in the breakfast room. But we had all the food we wanted/needed and weren't hassled by anyone, so no complaints. CONS: -the furniture/carpet in the room was a little dated, so no awards for being modern. Not too bad, though. -Regarding the aforementioned huge bathroom: the shower head was one of those 100-stream types and was very nice, but that also means it was big and heavy, and would only stay upright when the water was turned on. This wouldn't be an issue, except that when I turned the water off at the end of my shower, the shower head came crashing down, fell off its cradle and hit me in the head. Happened to both me and my gf on our first night...poor (and somewhat dangerous) design. -Location. This seems to be a "PRO" for many people, and even I have listed the proximity to the train station as a plus above. However, we found ourselves wanting to spend more time in the Pantheon/Piazza Navona area of town at night, closer to the historic city center, so while the hotel was great, and is still walking distance (or a cheap cab ride) to everything, I would probably try to find something in a more central location next time. But if you know this is where you want to be, it's very convenient to the Republica Metro stop, easy walking distance to the Colosseum/Forum, etc. Really just a matter of personal preference. All in all, this was a very good hotel and I would gladly recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfbennett
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Location: * About a 10 minute walk from Termini * 2 minutes from the Republica Metro Station * Bus stop almost right in front of the hotel * Reasonable walking distance to many sites. Though the faster you learn how to use the Metro, buses, and the occasional taxi, the more your feet will thank you. We found the number 64 bus particularly useful from this hotel. Staff: * Staff was very friendly and very helpful. * All of the staff we talked to spoke very good English Room: * Our room and bathroom were good sized, even by American standards. * Our room faced Via Napoli and was quiet with the windows closed. I would expect the rooms facing the courtyard would be even quieter. * Air conditioned, a must if you go to Rome in July or August. * TV with quite a few Italian channels (it did have CNN International in English). A helpful hint if you decide to stay here, if the entrance on Via Nazionale is closed, go around to the other entrance on Via Napoli.
