Overall, I found this location no more frustrating to find then any of the other hotels we have stayed in while in Rome. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, well located hotel with great staff! :o)”
Reviews.Author: CaroleMLT
Reviews.Content: Hello, I've just come back (8th May) from 4 days in Rome where I staid at the Hotel Gea...and I'd go back again! The hotel is small but very well located on Via Nazionale which is a main shopping street, only 10mn walk from Termini Train station and 2mn from the Underground (Stop: Reppublica) There is even an Internet cafe across the street and I could walk to all the main attractions from there without any problem! It was a bit noisy due to my room overlooking a back street near a cafe but hey, I booked the last single room of the hotel at the last minute and it didnt stop me from sleeping anyway! (well I used to leave at 8h30 am and come back at Midnight/1am every day so didn't really bother me!). My room was clean and had everything I needed and the staff were awesome! I tried to speak a bit of Italian with them and they were really helpful and making jokes! :o) I even came back at 1am one night to find that the poor guy at reception had been up all night waiting for me as I was the last guest to get back to the hotel! And he even had a smile on his face! bless him! The only thing which wasn't brilliant was the breakfast but there are so many cafes in Rome, I mean if you really need something more, just find a bakery and you can buy a huge pack of 30 buns/mini croissant/biscuits for 3 Euros! So yeah, if (and I will) I go back to Rome, I'll definitely book this hotel again, if only for the staff :o) Well recommended :o) Carole

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: emmabbey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in April 2007. Very central location, clean, nice hotel. Very pleasant staff. Breakfast was a little disappointing - canned fruit instead of fresh fruit but that's my only complaint. I was attending a wedding in the Hotel Quarinale and the Hotel Gea di Vulcano is directly across the road from The Hotel Quarinale. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints”
Reviews.Author: JSA27
Reviews.Content: Attentive staff, good breakfast, and a handy location--close to the Metro and close but not too close to Termini. Easy walking to shopping, Forum, etc. We had a suite for our family of four for three nights, and a large room for one night on our way home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: Sardinianovice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during March. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Our room was more like a small suite than a double room. We had a hall, small lounge, bedroom and en-suite facilities. Our room wasn't in the main part of the hotel, it was like having an apartment. The hotel is very centrally located, everywhere is within walking distance, if you don't mind walking 15-20mins. We've no complaints over breakfast either. There is fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, toast, cheese and ham, plus cakes. The staff were incredibly helpful and nothing was too much trouble. They even managed to obtain some basketball tickets for us. This hotel is a great find, very clean, convenient, and value for money. We paid 115 euros/night, very reasonable compared to most hotels in Rome. For cheaper restaurants/trattorias, head for Travestere, lovely part of rome, with plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paris_lane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gea for 4 nights in March. I was travelling with three young adults. We arrived in Rome at Orly and travelled by bus to the Termini. We then walked with bags to the Hotel, I had read that the Hotel could be difficult to find at night so I was prepared. There is a small sign with the hotel name beside the front door. However if you arrive at night you may miss it as the door is shut. You just ring the intercom and they are very prompt at comming to let you in. The gentleman was very friendly and took us to our room which was not with the rest of the rooms. You accessed it from the side street through another door up a few steps and it was by itself. We were blown away by the room and the space! It had a first room with two pull out twin beds, we only used this room to visit together in the evening, then a large hall with a large bathroom off of it (shower only). Then you had the next room wich was a double and then another room with two twins. All the rooms were very spacious and nicely decorated. They had nice amennities and big towels! They cleaned the room each day very well. The breakfast was plenty of food, which I had read the other reviews that mentioned the rationing of toast etc. This is true they have a limit on how much of each item you can take, however they give you several items. We had no problem with not enough food and the group I was with ate a lot! We are not a high maintenance group though. We wanted a place to stay, eat breakfast and take a shower and this exceeded our expectations. The few questions we needed answered they were more than eager to help and if they didnt know the answer they phoned someone who did. We had an early flight out and they arranged a cab for us and phoned us when it arrived. And then you add in the location, well it was perfect. As others have said you can walk to all the sights very easily. We took the metro to the Vatican and walked back. If you decide to do the Metro just be prepared it is crowded and you must be on alert for pick pockets. We also went out to the Appian Way and Catacombs and in this instance we took the bus. So this hotel is close for walking to the major sights and close to the termini for trains, busses and metro. I cant say enough good things about this hotel, I would definately return here. The kids said it was their favorite stay of the 4 places we had been. Great Going Gea, Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave&Trish
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed at the Gea Di Vulcano hotel in Rome and found it to be great. For the price that you pay in one of the most expensive cities in Europe this was excellent value for money. The room was a small suite and very nice, pleany of room, extremely clean and with all the mod cons you would expect. The breakfast was good and most importantly when in Rome and sightseeing, the location is fantastic. About a 10 minute easy walk to the Trevi fountain, 2 mins from the underground and 5 mins from the train station. The staff were extremely freindly and helpful and I would recomend this hotel to anyone as excellent value for money and very comfortable. Sure, its not the Ritz and does not have 5* facilities, but then you are not paying 5* prices! Also a tip for future visitors to this hotel, you MUST go to the restaurant Est, Est, Est. This is about 3 mins from the hotel, just off the via Nationale and is a fantastic little place. Full of locals and serving proper Italian food with no fuss, pomp or ceremony this restaurant was a true highlight of our trip. A full 4 course meal for 2 and bottle of wine cost just over 30euros and this was by far the best food we eat during the trip, despite paying triple this at other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: posso
Reviews.Content: We found it very clean, the staff very helpful, breakfast sufficiently good, location very good, room very nice. We would definitely stay there again. Good snackbars, restaurants & supermarket nearby. Metro not far. Don't delay - book today!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Philip J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gea di Vulcano from 02 to 05 Feb 2007 for a long (shopping-sightseeing) weekend with my girlfriend. The hotel was chosen for its good reviews in TA, as well as for its low price. The staff is friendly, they speak good English and the overall condition of the hotel is outdated but well kept. The public areas are clean. Location is good, only 2’ walk from the Metro station, and there is also a paid garage just across the road in Via Napoli (in case you have a car, about 25-28 Euros per day). Our room was small but adequate and quite clean. Bathroom was ok and there was always hot water. I suppose one can't expect too much from a 3* hotel @100 euros per night, but there are a few negative things that are worth mentioning: - Despite what we had arranged, our bed was not a double but rather two single ones put together - The staff vacuum-clean the corridors at 09:00am, so sleeping late is out of the question - The breakfast is very limited, coffee is not that good (strange for an Italian hotel) and to add insult to injury, you get charged extra if you eat more the 2 pieces of toast! - The air conditioning/heating made a lot of noise so we couldn’t have it on full blast. - The extra duvet we found in the cupboard had some VERY nasty stains on it so using it was out of the question. - The receptionist had very limited knowledge of good restaurants to recommend, we asked him for a nice Tuscan restaurant and he didn’t know any at all! (By the way we found this amazing Tuscan restaurant “Dal Toscano” on via Germanico 58/60, you MUST eat there at least once!) Despite these negatives, I would probably recommend this hotel as the value for money is better than I might imply. Hotels in Rome are very expensive and you will be hard pressed to find a much better hotel at 100 euros per night...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gea”
Reviews.Author: Russpo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a "suite" apartment style room located half way up the rear stairway over the Christmas week. Very impressed with the staff and a very good location with all major sites within 50 minute walk (with 2 young children). Longest walk was to Vatican.Room a little old fashioned for my taste and only 1 english language tv station - CNN - but probably no bad thing. Cake and wine given by hotel for Xmas Day - very nice touch. Local small supermarket, McDonalds (kids insisted and we gave in once). Small but adequate continental breakfast - self service. All in all - good value for money - paid E185 per night for the room (2 x double beds). Rome itself was fantastic - highlights the Vatican Museums, St Peter's, Pantheon, St Peter's in Chains, Forum. A little disappointed by crowds and intrusive souvenir salesmen at Trevi and Spanish Steps. Shocked by number of beggars and amount of graffiti.

Reviews.Title: “Another Vote in Favour”
Reviews.Author: smacdvanbc
Reviews.Content: This is a great find for budget travellers. The staff could not have been more helpful. The single room I booked was spacious, well furnished, and very comfortable. Excellent bed (a double). Breakfast was the best of my Italian trip. A great location for touring Rome, within walking distance of Termini yet not part of the 'Termini neighbourhood'. Off season prices offer exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scientist-Mad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here from 11-14th Oct. We were both delighted with our choice. Location: Central. 5 mins walk from Termini station, 2 mins from Republica metro station. 20 mins walk to Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. Bus stop right outside the hotel with buses to every destination in Rome. Plenty of eating places and a superstore nearby. Room: Very large, spacious and clean with air-con and climate control. Bathroom: Spotless. Staff: Friendliest staff in Italy. They even let us use their computer to download our photos. They also arranged an iron and ironing board for me in the breakfast room. None of the hotels we stayed in Italy (Rome, Florence, Venice and Milan) provide iron. Breakfast: Simple and nice though their coffee was warm (not hot) every morning. Overall: Very pleased and would definitely stay here if we return.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gea di Vulcano
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 243, 184 Rome, Italy
